qas.question: Where are there still populations of indigenous peoples?
Belize, Chile and Greenland are just some countries with sizable populations of what peoples?
How many different indigenous languages are spoken in the Americas?
What do many indigenous cultures still practice to different extends to this day?

answers.text: religion, social organization, and subsistence practices

qas.question: What have some indigenous peoples managed to remain in relative isolation from?

context: <a0_0>Many parts of the Americas<a0_0/> are still populated by <a1_0>indigenous<a1_0/> peoples; some countries have sizable populations, especially Belize, Bolivia, Chile, Ecuador, Greenland, Guatemala, Mexico, and Peru. <a2_0>At least a thousand<a2_0/> different indigenous languages are spoken in the Americas. Some, such as the Quechuan languages, Aymara, Guaraní, Mayan languages, and Nahuatl, count their speakers in millions. Many also maintain aspects of indigenous cultural practices to varying degrees, including <a3_0>religion, social organization, and subsistence practices<a3_0/>. Like most cultures, over time, cultures specific to many indigenous peoples have evolved to incorporate traditional aspects, but also cater to modern needs. Some indigenous peoples still live in relative isolation from <a4_0>Western culture<a4_0/> and a few are still counted as uncontacted peoples.
